channeldata.description: What's in the oven? - A Bakefile, which looks and feels like the good parts of a Makefile. - Except, you can write real bash code! Any and all syntax is accepted — no magic going on here. ;) - Unlike Makefile, you may utilize (4 × U+0020 a.k.a. “spaces”) for indentation. - Environment variables are explicitly passed or whitelisted (--allow), not inherited from the parent shell. - Tasks can be run safely and reliably. Rest assured that scripts are executed from the project root directory. - There are many other benefits to this design, that have yet to be expressed in this document.
channeldata.summary: Bake — the strangely familiar workflow utility.
